Portal 2-это увлекательнейшая игра с очень продуманными галаваломками и сюжетом.  Куча разностей, интересностей, и разнообразностей. Очень много пасхалак и потайных комнот с прикольными рисуночками. Но самое интересное, это большое каличество, как ни в одной игре, самых продуманых и очень интересных достижений. Очень саветую поиграть всем.

Ce jeu est tout simplement sublime ! Autant le 1er opus m'avait agréablement surpris, antant celui-ci est une claque !
Tout y est : - Des graphismes somptueux (je suis resté scotché sur quelques plans)
                   - Une histoire palpitante
                   - Le même gameplay que le précédent en plus perfectionné (gels, ponts de lumière...)
                   - Des énigmes prises de tête avec du vrai challenge
                   - Un mode coop vraiment bien foutu
                   - Une durée de vie quasi infinie avec les salles de test de la communauté
                   - Et surtout un très grand sens de l'humour qui m'a fait sourire bien des fois

This game ruined my life. It destroyed it; it took over my entire existence. A year ago, I was an innocent human being, as I had not yet paid any significant attention to the game, little did I know, my life would change completely upon being given the game as a gift. I wasn't too phased about it when I started it up, however, I quickly fell to the charm of that ridiculous little robot ball. I fell in love with him almost immediately. I fell in love with Wheatley and I can't get out. Please help me. I'm in love with a robot ball. Sometimes I replay the game and cry. I've passed it ten times now. Do not play this game. Don't. Please don't risk becoming like me. Flee, escape from the grasp of this evil.
I still don't know why i should shuttle back and forth the door.It's pretty brain-impaired.

Portal fue una auténtica maravilla, pero esta segunda parte mejora en todo: gráficos, jugabilidad, opciones, historia, longitud, etc. El añadido de Whatley es un acierto como contrapunto de Glados, una maravilla ver las riñas y las personalidades de ambos. A diferencia del primero, aquí los escenarios varian mucho, lo mismo que las situaciones y el avance de la historia, no sientes que estes haciendo pruebas porque si, estas avanzando por el entorno (cosa que conseguía el primero, pero aquí se expone en su máxima expresión). Lo conseguido por Valve es de elogío, que un juego de puzzles sea tan adictivo cogiendo el concepto de los dos portales, una idea original y muy bien llevada.

Recomendado 100%.

[h1]Si vous avez aimé le premier [i]Portal[/i] (et que vous avez bon goût en général), ce jeu est LE jeu qu'il vous faut.[/h1]

J'ai beau chercher et même après plus d'une trentaine d'heures de jeu, je ne trouve toujours pas de défauts. Le rajout d'un multi par rapport à [i]Portal 1[/i] est juste une idée géniale, l'humour est toujours au rendez-vous (encore plus que dans le premier opus), des beaux graphismes, un gameplay agréable, un VRAI scénario, une VRAIE histoire, des VRAIS personnages (Cave Johnson, tu es officiellement mon nouveau dieu),... En plus, [i]Portal 2[/i] et [i]Half-Life 2[/i] comptent parmi les rares jeux qui se sont construit une légende lors de leurs développement (renseignez-vous un peu sur les bêtas de [i]Portal[/i] et [i]Half-Life[/i] et vous comprendrez ce que je veux dire). Je pense que [i]Portal 2[/i] compte parmi le top 3 des meilleurs jeux auxquels j'ai joué. Que voulez-vous de plus ? À acheter d’urgence.

è UN GIOCO FANTASTICO

Starting with the Single-player campaign (no spoilers): I played it first on the PS3 when my brother got it. Back then I was enraptured in the whole story, much of which kept me on my toes (or should I say spring-boots?). Character development, continuing the story arc, and psychological hurdles are all present, as you would expect, given the first Portal game. I must say it was every bit exilharating playing through it on the PC the second time as it was on the PS3.

DLC: (kindof spoilerish) Secondly, the Portal 2 Testing Initiative for the PC version of the game is one of the greatest inventions of modern gaming. Countless thousands of intricate, confounding puzzles that you can download and play through - all created by users like you - are available in the 'Community' section for the game on the Steam platform. The tool is so in-depth that many of the unique puzzles I have played through have had traps that caught me completely off-guard, which subsequently left me fearing for my life even though real me wasn't in any real danger - and I loved it.

Multiplayer: This aspect of the game is, in my opinion, less fulfilling. There is not a story, really, you have to work with your friend to solve the puzzles. There's not much more to it than that. That's not to say the multiplayer is not fun, though! My brother and I spent hours playing together solving them as a team, hitting each other and whatnot as siblings do. It's a whole new experience in multiplayer, just as fun as the campaign.

A must-play on your gaming to-do list, and thoroughly exciting, all across the board, 11/10.

Portal 2 was a great experience. Loved the story and the puzzles.  There were about 2 chapters I didn't care for because I felt like I was just wandering around only to search for hidden walls that I could portal through rather than solving puzzles.  But the game itself had many puzzles that entertained me, and I can't complain too much as there are hundreds of puzzles to download online for portal 2.  Great game, definitely recommend it!

This game did a wonderful job of improving of an already great first game. They switched it up as to not make the game get repetitive and kept a wonderful, hilarious story. I wish there was more!

What more can be said about this gem?  Probably my favorite game since the original Unreal Tournament 15 years ago.  I'm giving it the nod over the first Mafia because it does NOT contain a profanity-inducing car race.

There is practically nothing about this game that doesn't work.  The characters are impeccably written and adeptly acted.  The puzzles are challenging but rarely frustrating, and as such very rewarding when you finish them.  It's stable as a rock and oozes style and polish.

And it's a hilarious game to boot.  Those "crap" turrets made me laugh harder than I have in several years.  Seriously, I was dying.

Haven't tried co-op (yet) but I have no doubt it will be just as swoon-worthy as the single-player campaign.  So get it already!

UPDATE: I did play co-op and loved it.  Word of advice: if you're playing co-op for the first time, make sure the person you're playing with is also playing it for the first time. Otherwise you'll get constantly nagged and prodded and told where to go.  It works better when you both figure out the levels together.

UPDATE #2: It looks like this will be the review I always revise to get Steam Awards XP points. But hey, it's Portal 2! It's still awesome. Go get it.

UPDATE #3: Time for some more XP. If I'm updating this, the game is probably on sale now. So go buy it already.
